PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Normal Volunteer Peripheral Blood Lymphocyte Pheresis

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Normal Volunteer Peripheral Blood Lymphocyte Pheresis
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A lymphocyte circulating in the peripheral blood._A procedure that collects a component of the peripheral blood while returning the rest to the donor._An individual who is or becomes a participant in a research study and has no significant health-related issues.

Concepts.definition: A lymphocyte circulating in the peripheral blood.
A procedure that collects a component of the peripheral blood while returning the rest to the donor.
An individual who is or becomes a participant in a research study and has no significant health-related issues.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A process of active consideration of potential subjects for enrollment in a trial.: A health care facility where patients are admitted to get treatment provided by a group of physicians practicing medicine together.: The act of going to see some person or place or thing; it can cover a short or long period but refers to a non-permanent arrangement.

Concepts.definition: A process of active consideration of potential subjects for enrollment in a trial.
A health care facility where patients are admitted to get treatment provided by a group of physicians practicing medicine together.
The act of going to see some person or place or thing; it can cover a short or long period but refers to a non-permanent arrangement.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A type of study protocol designed to evaluate intervention(s) for disease treatment.: The act of registration, entering in a list, catalog, group, study; also, the number of subjects enrolled.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A layer of supportive cells that are irradiated to prevent replication but can still secrete growth enhancing factors for use in co-culture: The smallest units of living structure capable of independent existence, composed of a membrane-enclosed mass of protoplasm and containing a nucleus or nucleoid.: A procedure in which blood is collected, part of the blood such as platelets or white blood cells is taken out, and the rest of the blood is returned to the donor.

Concepts.definition: A layer of supportive cells that are irradiated to prevent replication but can still secrete growth enhancing factors for use in co-culture
The smallest units of living structure capable of independent existence, composed of a membrane-enclosed mass of protoplasm and containing a nucleus or nucleoid.
A procedure that collects a component of the peripheral blood while returning the rest to the donor.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Lymphocytes that show specificity for autologous tumor cells. Ex vivo isolation and culturing of TIL with interleukin-2, followed by reinfusion into the patient, is one form of adoptive immunotherapy of cancer.: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.

Concepts.definition: Lymphocytes that show specificity for autologous tumor cells and can infiltrate a tumor.

A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.
